p: Using CTSL as a marker for viral entry gene expression, it was compared to the expression of type I IFN antiviral response genes ( IFITM3, MX1, SAMHD1, and TRIM25) in GSE157103, which includes a large transcriptomic dataset from hospitalized COVID-19 patients requiring non-ICU care (50), ICU-level care (50), as well as 26 control patients without COVID-19. With non-severe (non-ICU) COVID-19, there was increased expression of the viral entry gene ( CTSL ( p < 0.05)) and increased antiviral response genes ( MX1 ( p < 0.0001), SAMHD1 ( p < 0.0001), TRIM25 ( p < 0.01), IFITM3 (ns)). During severe (ICU-level) COVID-19, three of the four antiviral response genes were no longer upregulated (Supplementary Fig. S5).
